meanings.definition: A method of construction in which concrete is poured continuously into a moving form.
meanings.sent1: The workers used a slipform to build the tall concrete wall.
meanings.sent2: The slipform allowed for the smooth pouring of concrete in the construction project.
meanings.sent3: Why did the slipform refuse to hold the concrete? It wanted a break!
meanings.sent4: The slipform was like a magic mold shaping the building from liquid stone.
meanings.sent5: The slipform moved gracefully, turning wet concrete into solid walls.

meanings.sent1: The slipform was carefully designed to create the desired shape of the structure.
meanings.sent2: The workers adjusted the slipform to ensure the concrete took the right form.
meanings.sent3: The slipform and the concrete had a race - who would set first?
meanings.sent4: The slipform stood tall and proud, guiding the construction process.
meanings.sent5: The slipform was like a sculptor, molding the building with precision.

meanings.definition: To construct using the slipform method.
meanings.sent1: The builders decided to slipform the entire structure for efficiency.
meanings.sent2: They slipformed the walls to save time and resources in the project.
meanings.sent3: When the workers slipform, the building seems to rise like magic!
meanings.sent4: She slipforms with such skill that the concrete flows like water under her touch.
meanings.sent5: The team slipforming the tower worked in harmony, creating a masterpiece.
